question.title: Single Connection object at a time

node.contents: try learning about Singleton pattern and DAO

astNode.text: try learning about Singleton pattern and DAO

node.contents: Basically i just want work only single sql connection at a time, wait other connection until first close.

astNode.text: Basically i just want work only single sql connection at a time, wait other connection until first close.

elements.contents: Class myConnection { private static Connection con=null; public void getConnection() { con= DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:sqlite:" + properties.getProperty("sqliteDatabase")); } public void closeConnection() { con.close(); } public static void main(String s[]){ myConnection m1=new myConnection(); m1.getConnection(); //m1 object using con variable myConnection m2=new myConnection(); //m1.still executing query using con object m2.getConnection(); //i should not allow m2 access con object till con object is null }

node.contents: i know it is not a right program. i just tried to explain what i want to do. In short, i want single connection should work, wait another until connection is close.

node.contents: Thanks, this is something new i learned. but company have already DAO pattern class. i have to just modify it in such way only one connection should work. After first connection close,automatically second connection should start.

node.contents: now only one thread can get a connection from pool, others will block

astNode.text: now only one thread can get a connection from pool, others will block

node.contents: You can create pool of Connection object with size 1. For example have : ConnectionProvider class.

astNode.text: You can create pool of Connection object with size 1. For example have : ConnectionProvider class.

node.contents: I dont want to restrict the user to create another connection. instead i have to wait user until connection will close.

astNode.text: I dont want to restrict the user to create another connection. instead i have to wait user until connection will close.

node.contents: ok then implement synchronized method, i am updating my answer.

astNode.text: ok then implement synchronized method, i am updating my answer.

elements.contents: Class myConnection { private static Connection con=null; public synchronized void getConnection() { con= DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:sqlite:" + properties.getProperty("sqliteDatabase")); } public synchronized void closeConnection() { con.close(); } public static void main(String s[]){ myConnection m1=new myConnection(); m1.getConnection(); //m1 object using con variable myConnection m2=new myConnection(); //m1.still executing query using con object m2.getConnection(); //i should not allow m2 access con object till con object is null }

comments.text: //m1 object using con variable myConnection m2=new myConnection(); //m1.still executing query using con object m2.getConnection(); //i should not allow m2 access con object till con object is null }
//m1 object using con variable myConnection m2=new myConnection(); //m1.still executing query using con object m2.getConnection(); //i should not allow m2 access con object till con object is null }

node.contents: Synchronized method can be called once at a time, No two objects can call synchronized method at the same time, If they call then one will have to wait for other.

astNode.text: Synchronized method can be called once at a time, No two objects can call synchronized method at the same time, If they call then one will have to wait for other.
